The 11 teams of the league played a 50-game season. The top four teams of each division make the playoffs. The winner of the OJHL playoffs, the [[Guelph Platers]], won the OHA Buckland Cup and then the [[Dudley Hewitt Cup]] as Central Canadian champions. The Platers then defeated the [[Fred Page Cup|Callaghan Cup]] chammpions from the Maritime Provinces to move on to the [[1982 Centennial Cup]].
